values:
Why is it that almost every entry I make here begins with something like 'I haven't updated this in forever'? I'm fucking lazy. Jesus Christ.

So, you know, here I am. Here I've been. Self imposed solitary confinement is nice, but sometimes it wears a little thin. I think I need to get out and see a few old friends. First on the list is Carlson. It was nice to hear from someone after so long. I spent 90% of my time with Lori, which is fantastic, but it would be cool to see some old familiar faces again.




What the fuck would an LJ post be if I didn't gush over all the shitty music I've been hooked on?

Sunn O))). Neurosis. Isis. Ocean. Mastodon. Pelican. Red Sparrows. Gregor Samsa. Godspeed You Black Emperor. Swans. 

And when I'm feeling all icky happy...Rose Melberg. Fuck what you heard on Pitchfork. Her new record is gorgeous.



Time for bed. Bye children.

So, I hardly wrote in this journal all year, but that won't stop me from posting my list of the best music of 2005. Enjoy.

Long time. What's up. Post and tell me how lifes going.

This cold of mine is working me over well.

Tonight was spent writing music. Well, at least a piece of the night was spent in that way.

I just finished burning a cd for someone. Care to take a peek at the playlist? Read on, little children, read on.

01. Cat Power - In This Hole
02. Giddy Motors - Hit Car
03. Idaho - Wandering The Fields

It's about time to blow my nose, brush my teeth, and sleep.

Leonard Cohen makes me feel like a little kid sometimes.

It has been quite some time since I wrote here. I never really think of it anymore. That's probably due to the fact that I'm quite sure nobody cares to read about what's going on in my life anymore. Hell, I don't even care to write about it, to be honest.

Alright, so it's true. I've become a hermit. We all know this. It has been a steady decline for a couple of years now. Is decline the right word? Is cutting yourself off from a load of shitty people who were more concerned with hair and clothes and they were about people really such a bad thing? I'm inclined to say, no, not at all. However, I have lost touch with some upstanding, genuine people, and that part upsets me. 

Let me also say, the people who I do have around are great. The above complaints should in no way make them feel any less important.

So about a week ago (maybe longer. The days are running together.) I spoke to Jesha. It was nice to catch up and hear about what she has been doing, from her own mouth. I read her lj, but that couldn't feel any more impersonal. I just now spotted a new picture of her. It's weird how much people change over the years. It has been a long time since she and I met, and we've been to hell and back, but I'm still very glad to know her, and it's comforting on many levels to be on good terms with her still.

I just realized I need to buy Dinosaur Jr tickets soon. If that show sells out and I don't have a ticket, I'm pretty sure I'll flip the fuck out.

I wish Nick Cave was my dad.
Ok, I can't keep my dirty secret locked inside any longer. I'm in love with that song Mr. Brightside, by that piece of shit band The Killers. Does this make me a bad person?

Don't you love it when someone you know makes a big fuss about how horrid the current state of music is, and they just go on about how no bands these days are any good? You mention an album that you've been listening to and enjoying, regardless of it being an overhyped monster, and this person gives you some bullshit about how much that band sucks...but here's where it gets interesting. A month later that same person is quoted as saying "I love this record". Priceless. I know we've all done it from time to time, but man is it fucking annoying. Just admit you fucking like something, instead of playing it ultra fucking cool by saying it sucks, simply because more than 3 people say that it doesn't. If shits good, it's good, regardless.

My chest is in complete disarray. Tight, full of phlegm. The works. This shits going around and apparently it's my turn. Bastards.

You know, last year was a good year for music. There were quite a few fine records released, a few of which still see near constant play in my stereo. This year is shaping up to be even better. So far the cream of the crop has to be the new Six Organs of Admittance. I haven't stopped listening to is since I got it. Then of course you've got the new Decemberists. Need I say more there? You either love them or hate them, and I'm not afraid to admit to the former. Oh, and the Yo La Tengo 3CD set. Not exactly new music, but a new release just the same.

The Wedding Present are playing out here soon. Tickets need purchasing.

What the fuck? It smells like spring. Where the hell did that come from? I forgot we had seasons other than Winter out here. What a nice surprise.

Bed time. Fuck you.

It's getting late and I'm just sitting here in the living room waiting for friends to get back from a show. A sucky show. I'm not even going to go into details. I just hope they get in soon, because I'm sick of being in with nothing to do. So far my evening has consisted of the following;

- Playing my guitar a bit.
- Playing my Xbox a bit.
- Brainstorming on where to apply for jobs this week. Number 1 on the list is the new Newbury Comics opening at a mall out around Worcester.
- Watching tv for about 5 minutes before remembering that I hate tv unless it's Deadwood, The Shield, or The Venture Bros.
- Listening to the new Wedding Present cd on repeat. I think It's going on spin number 10 soon.
- Cleaning.

So as you can see, it's been quite the party over here. I think I need to make new friends. I think I'll take Scott up on his hangout invite this weekend. It'll be good for me.

I really want the new Bloc Party record. Does that make me a bad person? If I end up picking that up before the new Six Organs of Admittance, somebody shoot me. Please.

Oh, and I just found out that my "friends" have been home for 45 minutes and didn't bother to contact me. Nice. Whatever, they went to see Vanessa Carlton. I shouldn't be hanging out with people like that anyway.

Been some time since I updated. So I'm just here to say I'm alive and well.

Oh, and listen to the new Wedding Present record. It may sound a bit like Cinerama, but that doesn't mean it isn't the Weddoes. You'll love it.

I'll use Guided By Voices titles.

...::...Describe how you love:: Tractor Rape Chain

So Christmas was actually good this year. Imagine that. Got some nice gifts. Here's the rundown.

20" TV/DVD combo
New sweater
Scarf
Mittens
Slippers
PJs
DVDs:
Dawn of the Dead 4 disc collection
Shaun of the Dead
The Knack & How to Get It
The Marx Bros. - A Day At The Races
Space Ghost C2C Vol. 2
CDs:
Isis - Panopitcon
The Soft Boys - Underwater Moonlight reissue
Daniel Johnston - The Early Recordings Vol.1
Heated Blanket

So as you can see, good stuff. Im happy. And it was nice actually spending Christmas with Lori this year. We went and saw The Life Aquatic. I have to say, Willem Dafoe (spelling?) stole the show in that movie.

The moment none of you have been waiting for, and I've been looking forward to all year. 2004s Best Albums list. Enjoy.

There you have it. Those are my picks for the best of the best. There were more than a few that I would have liked to have included. There just wasn't any room. Have to keep it at 50, right? 

I know what you're thinking. Yes, both Pitchforkmedia.com and Tinymixtapes.com had The Arcade Fire and Animal Collective in the numbers 1 and 2 spots, respectivly. There's a reason for that though. Those two records are THAT fucking good! It didn't feel right putting them any lower. I had a hard enough time deciding between the two of them for the numero uno spot.

You are Bonnie Prince Billy - I See A Darkness

What essential indie rock album are you?
brought to you by Quizilla The weather is getting colder by the day. It's snowing as I type this. My beard is getting longer, and I've put back on 6 of the 10 lbs I had lost. I need to drink more water and eat less junkfood. I've been listening to Idaho a lot, and trying to get better on my guitar. This is my life.

Some of us were out there trying to make a difference. Some of us know the issues, and know enough to make educated decisions. It's just a crying shame that more of us don't fit into that small demographic of young people who understand that things aren't going to change themselves. We have a strong enough collective voice, that if even half of us had gone out and voted, the election would have been ours. However, only 17% of people between the ages of 18 - 29 thought that the world we live in matters enough to get off the couch and down to the polls. That's the exact same number as last election. The Republicans were quite happy when they announced on the radio that our generation had not come out in droves as was expected. Why is it that young people still cling to the nihilistic punk ethos of the late 70s? Is it really cool to say "fuck you" to society? Hell, at least in the 80s, the punks cared enough to have some sort of movement. Tell your friends, if you really want to rebel, then rebel agains those who are keeping you from getting a job, keeping you from getting health care, keeping your homosexual friends from having the rights they deserve, and trying to keep a woman from truly owning their bodies. With rebellion must come action.

Haven't updated in a while.

Sunday night Lori and I went to see The Mountain Goats/John Vanderslice. Needless to say, it was great. Lots of J.D. being his usual fantastic self, great music, and even a bit of two headed boy from the Goats. 2nd time ever. Beat that. You can't. 

Lori and I didn't go see Magnolia Electric tonight though. She has a long 12 hour day of school tomorrow and wouldn't be able to function on only 4 hours sleep. Can't say I blame her. We also won't be able to make it out to see them in RI tomorrow night because she won't be home from school in time. What a kick in the balls that is. Ahh well, there's always next time.

"Somethin filled up my heart with nothing. Someone told me not to cry. Now that I'm older, my hearts colder and I can't see that it's alive." - The Arcade Fire


What am I doing with my life? 23 and what do I have to show for it? Don't get me wrong, I'm not one to thing that being a young, creative, opinionated, educated person is a failure. However, as far as conventional standards go, I'm not getting anything done. I need to get out there, make money, pay more than just sales taxes, meet people, make connections, and get some fucking direction. So far this year wasn't the success story I had hoped for. The good news is that I've grown a lot as a person though, and that should certainly count for something. My personality has developed a lot, and that will help me get it together in the very near future.

I guess just not being in school or anything is getting to me. 

Ahh well, chin up right?

The flu has had me down and out for the past 3 or 4 days. Right now I'm on the home stretch. I'm coughing up things that have probably been in my lungs since the womb. I'm blowing out buckets of snot every 15 minutes. I could collect and market this shit.

What would I do without Lori? She came over the other day when I was at my worst, with soup, flu medicine, and jr. mints. It was wonderful. What a fantastic lady.

I'm supposed to be going to some family cookout today. Should be nice. I'm sure my extended family all want to watch/hear me blowing my snots all over the place while they eat. Sounds good to me.

I really like Frou Frou and I'm not ashamed to admit it!



Well...maybe I'm a little ashamed, but I suppose it could be worse.

You're Avante Garde Indie. You listen to abstract
music like free-jazz and Krautrock. You drink
too much coffee and you scare the fuck out of
the rest of us. We're afraid to call you
pretentious because we know that we all just
don't get it. There are few of you out there,
and most of you will probably die soon.

Joanna Newsom sounds far too much like a mix of Devendra Banhart and Lisa Simpson. I love her music, don't get me wrong, but come on. I feel like I'm listening to The Simpsons Sing Free Folk. 

Last night Lori and I went and saw the new Exorcist movie. I liked it a lot. It made Lori uncomfortable, and she ended up watching only about half of it. It was scarey, but it certainly was upsetting and creepy. Good character development also.

So tell me, why the hell is it that all of the Miles Davis reissues on Columbia are $8.99, except for the two that I REALLY want? Granted, Kind of Blue, On The Corner, Sketches of Spain, Porgy & Bess, etc. are fantastic, but I need a bit of Bitches Brew and Live-Evil. Sure, they're double cds. So why can't they be $19 instead of $25? Fuckers.

So, I need a fucking job. I wanted to work at Journeys with Lori, but the manager girl hasn't gotten back to me. It may be easier to find something now that people are going back to school, but shit, I need work NOW. Anyone know of anything?

How about a mix for the masses? Beat this, Jesha.


01. Miles Davis - Will O' The Wisp
02. Venetian Snares - Suffocate
03. Brian Eno - By This River
04. Swearing At Motorists - (It Came) Out of Nowhere
05. The Fall - Green Eyed Loco-Man

14. Sun Ra - Interplanetary Music

16. Pavement - Stop Breathin
17. Neutral Milk Hotel - Oh Sister

21. The Mountain Goats - Shadow Song

I probably shouldn't be on the computer right now, due to the constant thunderstorms. If it starts to get really bad, I'll shut it off. I'm actually glad it's raining so hard out. You could feel that it was coming for weeks.

So, what's new, right? Well, yesterday I spent the day shopping with Lori. Shopping with Lori consists of me following Lori around the Mall, going into every female clothing store she sets her eyes on. Sure, I complain a lot during these trips, but that's what gets me through them. The highlight was me trying to swoosh some shawl into Loris face while we were in Filenes, but accidentally knocking the hanger into her glasses. A woman who worked there was about 10 feet away when this happened, and looked like she was about to jump into action and either call the cops or take me down herself.

I picked up a copy of Miles Davis - On The Corner. Certainly one of my favorites of his records. I was looking for a cheap copy of Bitches Brew, which doesn't exist. The reissue is a solid $25. They did have Kind Of Blue, and Sketches Of Spain, both of which are essential. Good to know Newbury Comics sells their Davis and Coltrane for low prices. Now they just need to throw some Sun Ra into the $8.99 section.

I am becoming obsessed with Chess at this point. If I'm not playing it online, I'm wanting to play it. Tomorrow I'm going to teach Lori how to play. After this, we need to start up a Poker night. Carlson, you down broseph?

So, Jesha is in NH right now. Apparently she was in Boston yesterday. It feels weird knowing that she's only 2 hours from where I am. Oh well.

Alright, the lightning is kicking in. Time to go read a book.

Im in the middle...or perhaps more toward the end...of a fantastic conversation with my ex girlfriend, Willow. Its rare that she and I talk at length. When we do, it's almost always great. These talks leave me with an odd mix of emotions, but more than anything, they leave me with a smile. It's good to know that she has herself together and is doing well. She's one of the more interesting people that I've had the pleasure of knowing in my 23 years of life.

And of course, she's moving to California. Why do all the people I like more to Cali? Is it a sign?

SPARKYS REVENGE. WHO THE HELL ARE YOU?


I hate when creeps who I dont know have me on their LJ friends. I'm not even that interesting.

Well, I just finished reading entries by all of my beloved LJ friends, and the trend right now seems to be letting the general LJ reading public in on one musical fact.

So here's mine for the day...John Darnielle, Mr. Mountain Goats himself, played drums (if you can call what he did playing) in the sludge by way of noise by way of stoner rock band, The Bloody Hawiians.

Check them out, if you dare.

I've decided that I'm going to attempt to lose about 20 pounds. It sucks to have been thin basically all my life, and now I can't even fit into most of my jeans. Apparently there's a problem with my eating habits as of late. Time to change that.

Also, all I want in the world is a 20gb iPod. You should all donate money to me. Thanks.

So, I've been very hesitant about downloading or purchasing any new music these days. So much of it is horrid, with a few exceptions. However, I am very much considering picking up the new Fiery Furnaces. I downloaded a couple songs, and from what I've heard, it's far better than their first record. It just came out, so it must be on sale for pretty cheap. I'll look into that.

The more I think about it, the more I realize that Camera Obscura were pretty amazing when I saw them. They all seemed a bit uncomfortable on stage. It was adorable. They were kind enough to play quite a few songs from Biggest Bluest Hi Fi. How sweet of them.

I'm about to go to sleep, but I figured I'd make a quick entry.


Vacation in Cape Cod was pretty great. Then going straight from the Cape to the Camera Obscura show was also pretty damn great. Seeing the Rosebuds was semi-great.

Having to go sleep on monkey throw pillows...not so great.

Lobster magnets though. Come on. SO great.

I'm totally wired. Can't you see?

Actually, that isn't true. I'm totally tired. That sounds more on the mark. Either way though...

So it's Friday. TGIF, right? Lori and I are going to do something this afternoon and then later this evening probably head over to Chads. Then tomorrow we leave for the Cape. I'll be back Monday night. It will be nice to get away for a few days and do something different. Even though I don't like the beach.

Napoleon Dynamite. Has anyone seen it. Does it suck like I think it may?
Apparently I'm annoying because I know That Jeff Tweedy was in Uncle Tupelo and that Farrar was in Son Volt. Who knew that knowledge was annoying? News to me.

Another MIX! Jesha put me in the mood. If you don't like it, don't read it, chumps.

Ahhh, summer. Now if only the rain would stop.

Why do I put things off for so long? Going back to school, looking for a job, etc. I need to really just start getting things DONE. It's criminal to just waste my days.

Slanted & Enchanted. On sale. New copy, in my hands.

Oh, and Jules, Zen Arcade beats out New Day Rising. And I'm telling you, pick up a Sugar record. You'll thank me...

Oh, and lay of The Farrar and Tweedy. It'll kill you.

Just the band? Not a particular record by the band? Okay...

Reminds you of an ex-bf/gf: Songs: Ohia
Reminds you of an ex-friend: Today Is The Day
Makes you sad: Swans
Makes you laugh: The Danielson Famile
Makes you smile: The Mountain Goats
Never want to hear again: Gravy Train!!!
Sums up your teenage years: Minor Threat
You want to get married to: Rachel's
You like to wake up to: Johnny Cash
You like out of your parents record collection: ... 
You love that you wouldn't know about if it wasn't for a friend: The Avalanches
Reminds you of an old crush: Sugar
Reminds you of your now crush: N/A
Reminds you of your best friend: The Velvet Underground
Makes you think of sex: N/A
Makes you think of being alone: Bonnie Prince Billy
Has only been released recently but you love already: Magnetic Fields - I
Are embarrassed to admit you like: I can't think of anything...
Perks you up: 
Mellows you out:

Wilco sucks. I feel I need to say this. They're hideous. So just stick to listening to the Mekons. If you REALLY need a little bit of Jeff Tweedy in your life, opt for Uncle Tupelo.

Thanks.

What else is going on? Oh, well, I've been spending time with Lori. Thats been nice. Some people don't seem to think so, but then again, I don't care much about what some people think. Things are going pretty well. 

I'm starting to accept Lou Reed into my life. Transformer is, I must admit, a good record. I've been trying to say it was horrible for a long time, but my resistance is wearing thin. Loaded is still the worst The Velvet Underground had to offer, but then again, it wasn't exactly The Velvet Underground we all know and love. John Cale will always be the man. That's that.

My teeth hurt. So does my stomach. I need food, and then I need to brush the food leftovers away.

Last night was The Decemberists. 3rd time seeing them, and without a doubt the best. After a few technical difficulties during their set, they decided to end with an unplugged rendition of Red Right Ankle. It was gorgeous. Then after a lengthy period of applause, they all came back out to do a couple more unplugged songs, after which they again left the stage, and were followed by even more applause. Well, wouldn't you know it, they came out for a 2nd encore. There was just something special about everyone in the crowd being silent, or quietly singing along as the band played without the use of electricity. It was certainly a night to remember.

The new Belle & Sebastian is pretty bad. The new Sondre Lerche is pretty good.

Why are there basically no good shows coming up in Boston? This is looking to be a bleak summer.

Mon 7/26 @ The Middle East
Camera Obscura, The Rosebuds (Merge Recs) 18+ $10adv/$12DOS

That will probably be the highlight of the summer. A great show anyway, so I'll be happy to go.

Wow...I certainly am bored.

Harry Potter was so fucking good.

So is the new Camera Obscura record. Not the Camera Obscura from Cali, but the indie pop Camera Obscura from Scotland. Better than Belle & Sebastian, if you ask me. Yes indeed.

I spent my day working for my father. It was not fun. It WAS dusty though. My nose still hasn't stopped running.  I took a shower and I still feel dirty.

I need to find the two Royal City records. I want them. Big time.

The Decemberists show is next weekend. Wow. That came quickly.

I don't know what I'm doing tonight. I just hope it turns out being fun.

After giving the new Modest Mouse a bit of a chance, I've decided that it isn't as terrible as I had first assumed. I still don't think it's all that good, but as I said, better than I had given it credit for at first. I don't think they'll ever make another Lonesome Crowded West, so I suppose I'll have to accept what they've become. Oh, and what's with the drummer and his love of the stomp beats?

Tonight I will be heading out and seeing the new Harry Potter with Lori, and possibly Joel. Am I excited about this? You bet your ass.

Last night I picked up the first season of South Park on dvd. I had some store credit for a comic shop, and they had it used. It was a no brainer. I had never given that show a chance until this year, and let me tell you, I'm glad I did.

I havent updated in quite a while. Just haven't been in the mood.


I went to my first Red Sox game. They lost.


I've been reading a lot.


I'm hungry.

Do you ever randomly remember how much you fucking love a certain band who you've been neglecting for quite some time? This weekend, this happened to me a few times. I have fallen in love all over again with Clinic, The Soundtrack of Our Lives, Pulp, Bjork, and Whiskeytown. So, of course, those are all Im listening to tonight.

I lost a game of Monopoly this weekend. To LORI. She trounced Chad, Joel, and myself. It was disgusting. I am a broken man.

I shaved my chin and neck. I now have the beloved sideburns connecting to my mustache. I look 10 times more disgusting than ever, and it's beautiful. Don't be surprised if I'm arrested in some mix up because I look like the local child molestor.

I'm adding Jesha now. NOW!

So, I've never been a big fan of The New Pornographers, but Neko Case has some amazing solo stuff. 

The Pixies are playing Lollapalooza in NY. Fuck the MA dates, we need to get tickets for NY. Their only east coast show? You betcha.

I think I ate some bad chicken. I feel a bit ill at the moment. Or maybe it was the year old valentines day candy I got from the dollar store. Either way, I want to barf out my ass presently.

Ok. Someone elses turn.

Its nice and dreary outside. I don't like that in the winter, but I love it in the spring/summer. Nothing better. Lightning last night while I was walking to Chads. Wonderful.

I'm having a hard time finding all of The Handsome Familys records in stores, and even having a rough time of finding them online. I'd really like to get everything they've put out.

My nephew is insane.

I won an intense game of Monopoly last night. At one point it looked like I was going to be out. I made a comeback and took the win. How awesome am I? I'd like to start getting bi-weekly Monopoly games going. Anyone want in on this?

Nothing happening today, sadly. I would like to go out and do something, but it doesn't look like that's going to happen. So it'll probably just be me and my gameboy.

Bananas make my mouth feel weird.
